articles.author: Steve Keating
articles.title: Lightning zaps Canada's Stanley Cup dreams - Reuters
articles.description: Canada's Stanley Cup drought will continue for at least another year after the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Montreal Canadiens 1-0 on Wednesday to cap a successful National Hockey League title defence and heap more misery on an ice hockey-mad nation.
articles.content: Fans react as they watch the end of game five of the NHL Stanley Cup Finals between the Montreal Canadiens and Tampa Bay Lightning ice hockey teams in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, July 7, 2021. REUTERS/… [+2364 chars]

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Milwaukee beat Phoenix to claim NBA championship - Reuters
articles.description: The Milwaukee Bucks won the franchise's first NBA championship in 50 years with a 105-98 win over the visiting Phoenix Suns on Tuesday.
articles.content:
July 20 (Reuters) - The Milwaukee Bucks won the franchise's first NBA championship in 50 years with a 105-98 win over the visiting Phoenix Suns on Tuesday.
With the victory, the Bucks clinched the N… [+673 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX opens lower as concerns over jump in COVID-19 infections weigh - Reuters
articles.description: Canada's main stock index eased on Monday as concerns over a rise in coronavirus infections globally led investors hold back on trades, while Brookfield Business Partners jumped after it announced the takeover of a U.S. based car parts maker for $3.4 billion.
articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.author: Reuters
articles.title: Canada sheds 294200 jobs in June - ADP - Reuters
articles.description: Canada lost 294,200 jobs in June, mainly on a plunge in service sector jobs in industries hit hard by COVID-19 restrictions, a report from payroll services provider ADP showed on Thursday.
articles.content: People wait in line for resume critique and career assessment sessions at the 2014 Spring National Job Fair and Training Expo in Toronto, April 3, 2014. REUTERS/Aaron HarrisOTTAWA, July 15 (Reuters) … [+547 chars]
